intro: Micraira pungens, commonly known as the spiky poinsettia, is a striking plant native to Mexico. It is characterized by its vibrant red bracts that surround small, inconspicuous flowers. The plant belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many other ornamental and medicinal species. Its foliage is often covered in tiny, sharp spines, giving it a unique and somewhat intimidating appearance. Micraira pungens is popular as a holiday decoration due to its association with Christmas and its ability to thrive in indoor environments.
